name: Congenital Jejunal Atresia with Apple-Peel Configuration
chief_complaint: My newborn hasn't passed stool and is vomiting green fluid
physical_findings: absent bowel sounds in lower quadrants

lab_results.abdominal X-ray: double bubble sign with distal air absence

treatment: TPN until full enteral feeding established
prognosis: Good with prompt surgical intervention, but risk of short bowel syndrome if extensive resection required
description: A rare form of intestinal atresia where the jejunum ends in a blind pouch with the distal small bowel coiled around a single feeding artery (resembling an apple peel). Caused by intrauterine vascular accident of the superior mesenteric artery. Requires emergent surgical correction in neonates.
multiple_choice: Congenital Jejunal Atresia with Apple-Peel Configuration
